{"step_by_step_thinking": "Chelation is a chemical process in which a metal ion is tightly bound to an organic molecule. In the context of antibiotics, chelation with calcium can lead to decreased absorption and effectiveness of the antibiotic. Among the given options, tetracycline is known to chelate with calcium. Penicillin, cephalosporins, and erythromycin do not chelate with calcium.", "answer_choice": "B. Tetracycline"}
